questions.question_text: An audit program indicates that a specific number of transactions are to be sampled for testing a particular control. However, it has been determined that the control design is deficient. What should the IS auditor do in response to this information?

choices.C: Document the observation and the testing methodology used.
choices.A: Recommend a change to the audit program to increase the sample size.
choices.B: Recommend a change to the audit program and testing methodology used.
choices.D: Notify audit management and continue to use the sample size.

discussion.content: B I think is right. So it means that Compliance Testing result in not efficient. So another sampling should be used. In this case Substantive Testing

Selected Answer: A
B would be correct if the panning to outsource. In this scenario the plan is to bring dev in-house. Xorrect answer is A

Selected Answer: A
This is the greatest concern as it can significantly impact the organization's ability to maintain and support the application. Without clear documentation of the data model, the organization may struggle to understand the application's structure, which can make it challenging to fix issues or develop new features. Before transitioning support and future maintenance in-house, the organization should ensure that the data model is clearly documented and that the in-house team understands it thoroughly.

Selected Answer: B
The IS auditorâ€™s GREATEST concern in this scenario should be B. The vendor development team is located overseas1. While all the options are relevant considerations, the location of the vendor development team can significantly impact communication, collaboration, and responsiveness. Outsourcing to an overseas team may introduce challenges related to time zones, language barriers, cultural differences, and coordination difficulties. These factors can affect the quality of support and future maintenance when the organization brings the application back in-house.
A. The data model is not clearly documented.

questions.question_text: An organization has outsourced the development of a core application. However, the organization plans to bring the support and future maintenance of the application back in-house. Which of the following findings should be the IS auditor's GREATEST concern?

choices.C: The cost of outsourcing is lower than in-house development.
choices.D: A training plan for business users has not been developed.
choices.A: The data model is not clearly documented.
choices.B: The vendor development team is located overseas.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Server cages contain critical IT equipment, and fires in these areas can have a severe impact on data processing operations. Placing smoke detectors within server cages ensures early detection of smoke originating from or affecting these critical components.

questions.question_text: Where should photoelectric smoke detectors be installed to improve fire detection at an offsite data processing facility?
Which of the following is MOST important to effectively manage risk associated with application programming interfaces (APIs) and third-party virtual environments?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
inventory of APIs

Selected Answer: A
A is the correct answer
B. Purchase order, receipt and invoice are used for three way match

Selected Answer: A
Answer A
 The goods delivery notification, which is essentially the goods receipt or acknowledgment of receipt of goods, is crucial in this process. It serves as evidence that the goods have been received, which is a key component of the three-way match process

Selected Answer: B
Three-way match is the process of comparing the purchase order, invoice, and goods receipt to make sure they match, prior to approving the invoice.

Selected Answer: D
Option D, purchase order, is one of the three documents used in the three-way match process and is the starting point of the process. The purchase order indicates what was ordered, from whom, and the quantity and price of the goods or services.

questions.question_text: Which of the following should an IS auditor use when verifying a three-way match has occurred in an enterprise resource planning (ERP) system?
